title: Interactive Terminal GUI Capability Audit + Build Verification
description: Assess whether the Interactive Terminal GUI app from plan_mllgo3rk_e6a1fff0 can host PowerShell and multiple terminal types, verify multi-terminal tabbed behavior in current implementation, and perform an actual build verification of the app.
goals: Determine current terminal backend capabilities (PowerShell and other shell/process support).
Determine whether current implementation supports multiple concurrent terminals with tabbed interface.
Build the Interactive Terminal GUI app successfully (or capture exact blocker).
Provide clear yes/no answers with evidence and concrete gap list.
success_criteria: Implementation review references concrete files/components showing terminal type and tab/multi-session behavior.
Build command for interactive-terminal is executed using registered build script and result recorded.
Final report states capability status: currently supported, partially supported, or missing for each requested feature.
Any gaps include actionable next-step recommendations.

agent_sessions.summary: Executed Step 0 and Step 1. Reviewed archived artifacts for plan_mllgo3rk_e6a1fff0 and current interactive-terminal implementation. Determined shell/backend capability is partial for explicit PowerShell (cmd/sh dispatch model) and determined tabbed multi-terminal concurrency is not implemented (queue + single active display, single-client TCP). Captured structured capability matrix with evidence and limitation notes; handed off recommending Reviewer.

Executed Step 2 and Step 3. Step 2: followed build script workflow (list_build_scripts -> run_build_script) for Qt release build; resolved command executed with one interactive-surface runtime mismatch (/bin/sh ENOENT) and successful host PowerShell build (Qt 6.10.2 + cargo release complete, warnings only). Step 3: produced direct capability verdict (PowerShell/terminal variety: partial; multi-terminal tabbed: missing) with evidence references and concrete implementation recommendations; stored findings in review context.

Completed required archival flow: init+validate as Archivist, verified all plan steps are done via memory_plan.get, reindexed workspace, and archived plan plan_mlmoos7f_e90cb553 successfully. No git commit/push performed per user constraint.

lineage.reason: Completed Step 0 and Step 1 capability audit with concrete evidence and limitations; ready for build-check and findings synthesis.
Step 2 and Step 3 completed: build verification executed and final capability verdict stored.

steps.task: Review plan_mllgo3rk_e6a1fff0 artifacts and current interactive-terminal code to identify supported terminal backends/shells (including PowerShell) and terminal spawning model.
steps.notes: Completed Step 0. Reviewed archived artifacts (architecture/state/build_report) and current implementation files. Confirmed single-client TCP model and shell dispatch design (cmd/sh), with concrete evidence collected.

steps.task: Verify whether current UI/runtime supports multiple concurrent terminals with tabbed interface; capture exact evidence files and any limitations.
steps.notes: Completed Step 1. Verified current UI/runtime does not provide tabbed multi-terminal sessions; supports queued command approvals with single active command display and single-client TCP connection. Evidence and limitations captured in research note.

steps.task: Run registered Interactive Terminal build script (Qt release) and report pass/fail with logs and blockers.
steps.notes: Resolved script `Build Interactive Terminal (Qt Release)` via run_build_script and executed command. Interactive terminal surface attempt failed with `spawn /bin/sh ENOENT` (tool runtime mismatch), then executed same resolved command in host PowerShell successfully: QMake 3.1 / Qt 6.10.2 detected, `cargo build --release` finished successfully in 31.21s with warnings only (unused imports/dead code).

steps.task: Produce final capability verdict (PowerShell/variety of terminals + multi-tab terminals), with gap list and recommended next implementation steps.
steps.notes: Produced final capability verdict with direct answers: (1) PowerShell/terminal variety = partial support; (2) multi-terminal tabbed interface = missing. Included evidence references and concrete implementation recommendations; stored in review context artifact at /data/project-memory-mcp-40f6678f5a9b/plans/plan_mlmoos7f_e90cb553/review.json.
